results.title: A place of power in French Polynesia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human face of the Pacific”.
This series looks at the Pacific islands, the traditions associated with them and issues that pose problems to them. Tahiti is looked at in this particular film. Through the eyes of Karim, a Polynesian dancer, we glimpse the effects of western world influences and the effects of French and Church influences on Polynesian society and customs.

results.title: A Place of dreams: National Air and Space Museum
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Peter S Vogt
results.brief_description: An examination of the Smithsonian Institute, home of America’s early planes. Shows through the use of early film and still photographs, the Wright Brothers’ early failures and successes; looks at the restoration of old planes at the museum; and presents a history of the development of flight in the United States. Presented by Cliff Robertson. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: A Place of compromise
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and Dietmar Fill
results.brief_description: A general introduction to the Australian seashore and its creatures. The place of compromise, is, in fact, that narrow skirt on every coastline where the lives of sea creatures are spent partly above and partly below the water line. The film uses normal and micro photography.

results.title: A Place in the sun
results.creator_credit: Junior League of San Francisco, University of California, Los Angeles and Jonathan Musser
results.brief_description: This film reveals the work being accomplished by doctors and specialists working in schools especially for the treatment of cerebral palsy. Children are seen being helpted to improve their muscular co-ordination and learning to do things for themselves such as putting on shoes, doing up buttons, and handling a knife and fork. Shows through patient handling by their instructors, the children are enabled to return to their own homes where the treatment is carried on by their parents under supervision.

results.title: A Place in the sun
results.brief_description: Director George Steven’s fought hard to make this powerful adaptation of Theodore Dreiser’s award-winning novel, “An American Tragedy”. Controversial and damning of the capitalist ethics of greed, this is a Hollywood melodrama of considerable insight and integrity. Montgomery Clift plays a young man from a poor religious family who begins working in his Uncle’s factory. He is attracted to the humble Alice (Shelley Winters) who works on the factory floor, but it is the rich Miss Vickers (Elizabeth Taylor) who he desperately wishes to love. She is a symbol of the status and wealth which he believes, as an American, is his due. When Alice falls pregnant and he realises all his hopes for success may be destroyed, he begins to slowly, painfully descend to thoughts of murder. With stunning performances by all three stars, a literate script and sumptuous direction by George Stevens, this is a labour of love deserving of its success. Winner of six Academy Awards.

results.title: A Place in the country: Renfrewshire Regional Park
results.creator_credit: Tree Films, Films of Scotland and David Lewis
results.brief_description: Describes the first country park to be established in Scotland. Different groups of people are seen visiting the park: a family picnic party, a young couple going for a walk, two hikers and a party of school children. A regatta at Castle Semple Loch is shown. The film shows the range of attractions the park holds for all.

results.title: A Place in life
results.brief_description: Blind people are no longer forced to live on the fringe of society. Schools for the blind and community centres are giving a thorough training to them so that blind people are enabled today to gain their livelihood in industry and economy.
